item.title: Susan add a quote by Lois Wyse
item.description: "So, if you have a grandma, thank the good Lord above, and give your grandmamma hugs and kisses, for grandmothers are to love." -- Lois Wyse

item.title: Susan add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "There's a time for departure even when there's no certain place to go." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Susan add a quote by Peter R Breggin
item.description: "Childhood trauma and sufferings does not provide us with an excuse for our problems. It explains the origins of our problems while in no way relieving us of the responsibity to understand and improve ourselves." -- Peter R Breggin

item.title: Susan add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "These virtues are formed in man by his doing the actions ... The good of man is a working of the soul in the way of excellence in a complete life." -- Aristotle

item.title: Susan add a quote by PEARL S. BUCK
item.description: "The young do not know enough to be prudent, and therefore they attempt the impossible -- and achieve it, generation after generation." -- PEARL S. BUCK

item.title: Susan add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "From everyone to whom much is given, much will be required." -- Anonymous

item.title: Susan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Grief can take care of itself, but to get the full value of joy you must have somebody to divide it with." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Susan add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Susan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "The animal merely makes a bed, which he warms with his body in a sheltered place; but man, having discovered fire, boxes up some air in a spacious apartment, and warms that, instead of robbing himself, makes that his bed, in which he can move about divested of more cumbrous clothing, maintain a kind of summer in the midst of winter, and by means of windows even admit the light and with a lamp lengthen out the day." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Susan add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword? 36 As it is written: "For your sake we face death all day long; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered." 37 No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us. 38 For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, 39 neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord." -- Anonymous

item.title: Susan add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Susan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Susan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Susan add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook." -- Julia Child

item.title: Susan add a quote by Calvin Trillin
item.description: "Health food makes me sick." -- Calvin Trillin

item.title: Susan add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Seize the moment. Remember all those women on the 'Titanic' who waved off the dessert cart." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Susan add a quote by Glenn Beck
item.description: "Whoever thought a tiny candy bar should be called fun size was a moron." -- Glenn Beck

item.title: Susan add a quote by George Lang
item.description: "Nobody knows the truffles I've seen." -- George Lang

item.title: Susan add a quote by Fannie Flagg
item.description: "The food in the South is as important as food anywhere because it defines a person's culture." -- Fannie Flagg

item.title: Susan add a quote by J.T. Peete
item.description: "Pray for peace and grace and spiritual food, for wisdom and guidance, for all these are good, but don't forget the potatoes. " -- J.T. Peete
